text: It was obvious less hardcore and more accessible but kiddie-fied? Less serious? Are you joking? In what way, shape or form was this game more kid-oriented and less serious? It was the exact same serious story and environment from the first two games, just less strictly following the Metroid formula
author: Zzyzx

text: It's good for a series to take a step into another direction occasionally. There's only so many times you can keep doing the Metroid formally exactly the same. It still had plenty of exploration and isolation, the vast majority of the places you go to are completely empty and open-ended. Adding the cutscenes and trooper protection gave it a much better way of feeling like you're part of a bigger battle going on, and was fitting for the end of the trilogy
author: Zzyzx

text: I think they were trying to appeal to a wider audience with Prime 3, with all the action-based cut scenes and characters.

text: I've come to a realization of a simple thing. The originals will always be the best they are the best of what those artists had to offer. They come and go with new ideas some good some bad. The fact is if you want a series to continue they cant make it perfect. If they did what else would be left to make. look at Call of Duty a almost identical engine in their last four games its old, its boring; its DEAD. ps. Beat all the Metroid games in order best song IMO
author: Charis bovis

text: It's not necessarily new things (like the multiple visor systems and such) but the deviation from what is the core of metroid that the public then liked. Like the feeling of exploration and isolation, not the cutscene based, helping troopers survive, deviation from that formula that MP3 was. Newer gamers might like it for what it is, but for me it deviated a bit too much from what makes the metroid series awesome. MP1 did that brilliantly.

text:
Bloggs. How I hate you. It's weird I heard this version first, then played Super Metroid and grew to love the original, then came back and re-loved this song.

text: I prefer the original version when listening outside of the game, but this one gave me a big nostalgia rush when I first heard it playing, a very nice suprise. My two favorite moments were when I first heard this and the Sanctuary Temple.
